Package Project2

Class Date

java.lang.Object
Project2.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Date>
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Date>
The Date class is used to represent dates in the format mm/dd/yyyy. It also contains methods to validate a given date, and compare dates to each other.
Author:
Srija Gottiparthi, Catherine Nguyen

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if a date is valid. A date is valid if it is after 1900, on or before the current date, and meets all other common requirements of a date. (e.g. the month existing, leap years being handled correctly, etc.)
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid, false otherwise

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Date date)
      Compares current Date object to another Date object. If the current Date object occurs later in the future than the given Date object, 1 is returned. If the current Date object occurs earlier in the future than the given Date object, -1 is returned. If both Dates are the same, 0 is returned.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      date - the date to compare to
      Returns:
      -1 if the current Date object is earlier, 1 if the current Date is later, 0 if equal

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the date.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the date

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      Parameters:
      args - the given arguments
